title: Matthew Chapter 17 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 17 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 17 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 17.

questions.question: Who did Jesus take up to the high mountain according to Matthew 17:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Peter, James, and John
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:1 states that Jesus took Peter, James, and John up into a high mountain.

questions.question: What happened to Jesus' appearance on the mountain in Matthew 17:2?
options: His face shone like the sun and his clothes became white as light
questions.correctAnswer: His face shone like the sun and his clothes became white as light
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:2 describes Jesus' face shining as the sun and his raiment being white as light during the transfiguration.

questions.question: Who appeared and talked with Jesus during the transfiguration?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses and Elias
questions.explanation: According to Matthew 17:3, Moses and Elias appeared and talked with Jesus.

questions.question: What did Peter suggest making for Jesus, Moses, and Elias?
questions.correctAnswer: Three tabernacles
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:4 shows Peter suggesting to make three tabernacles, one for each.

questions.question: What did the voice from the bright cloud say?
options: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him
This is my servant, obey him
The Lord is mighty and strong
questions.correctAnswer: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:5 records the voice from the cloud declaring Jesus as God's beloved Son and instructing to hear Him.

questions.question: What was the disciples' reaction to the voice from the cloud?
options: They fell on their face and were sore afraid
questions.correctAnswer: They fell on their face and were sore afraid
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:6 states the disciples fell on their face and were very afraid when they heard the voice.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to the disciples after they were afraid?
questions.correctAnswer: Arise, and be not afraid
questions.explanation: Jesus touched them and told them to arise and not be afraid in Matthew 17:7.

questions.question: What did Jesus instruct the disciples not to do until after He was risen from the dead?
options: Tell the vision to no man
questions.correctAnswer: Tell the vision to no man
questions.explanation: In Matthew 17:9, Jesus charged the disciples to keep the vision secret until after His resurrection.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say had already come, according to Matthew 17:12?
questions.correctAnswer: Elias
questions.explanation: Jesus said Elias had already come, referring to John the Baptist, in Matthew 17:12.

questions.question: What was the condition of the man's son who came to Jesus for help?
options: He was lunatick and sore vexed
questions.correctAnswer: He was lunatick and sore vexed
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:15 describes the man's son as lunatick and sore vexed.

questions.question: Why could the disciples not cast out the devil from the boy?
options: Because the boy was too sick
questions.correctAnswer: Because of their unbelief
questions.explanation: Jesus explained in Matthew 17:20 that their failure was due to unbelief.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 17:21, some kinds of demons can only be cast out by prayer and fasting.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:21 states that certain kinds of demons go out only by prayer and fasting.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus predicted in Matthew 17:22-23 that the Son of man would be betrayed, killed, and raised again on the third day.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus foretold His betrayal, death, and resurrection in Matthew 17:22-23.

questions.question: True or False: Peter answered that kings of the earth take tribute from their own children, according to Jesus' question in Matthew 17:26.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Peter said kings take tribute from strangers, not their own children, in Matthew 17:26.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Matthew 17:27: '...go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his ______, thou shalt find a piece of money.'
questions.correctAnswer: mouth
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:27 instructs Peter to open the fish's mouth to find the piece of money.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 17 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 17 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Matthew 17 teach us about the importance of faith when facing difficult challenges?
options: Faith as small as a mustard seed can move mountains
Faith is not necessary to overcome obstacles
Only great faith can accomplish anything
Faith is only for spiritual leaders
questions.correctAnswer: Faith as small as a mustard seed can move mountains
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:20 emphasizes that even faith as small as a mustard seed can move mountains, teaching us to trust God in all situations. This is supported by verses 14-18 where Jesus heals the boy when others could not, showing the power of faith and prayer.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with doubt about prayer. Based on Matthew 17, what biblical truth would you share about prayer?
options: Some kinds of struggles require prayer and fasting
Prayer is optional and not always effective
questions.correctAnswer: Some kinds of struggles require prayer and fasting
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:21 teaches that certain spiritual challenges require prayer and fasting, highlighting the importance of persistent and devoted prayer alongside faith.

questions.question: What does the transfiguration of Jesus reveal about His divine nature and how should this affect our trust in Him?
options: His face shone like the sun and His clothes became dazzling white
He appeared as a normal man without any change
He performed a miracle on the spot
questions.correctAnswer: His face shone like the sun and His clothes became dazzling white
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:2 describes Jesus' transfiguration where His face shone like the sun and His clothes became white as light, confirming His divine glory and encouraging us to trust Him fully.

questions.question: How does Matthew 17 instruct us about humility and reverence in the presence of God's glory?
options: The disciples fell on their faces and were afraid
questions.correctAnswer: The disciples fell on their faces and were afraid
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:6 shows that when the voice from the cloud spoke, the disciples fell on their faces and were greatly afraid, teaching us humility and reverence before God's glory.

questions.question: What encouragement does Jesus give when His disciples feel afraid or discouraged?
options: Fear is necessary at all times
questions.correctAnswer: Arise, and be not afraid
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:7 records Jesus comforting His disciples by telling them to arise and not be afraid, encouraging believers to trust God even in fearful situations.

questions.question: Based on Matthew 17, what should be our response when witnessing God's power in the lives of others?
options: Tell no one until the right time
questions.correctAnswer: Tell no one until the right time
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:9 shows Jesus instructing the disciples to keep the vision secret until after His resurrection, teaching discernment and humility in sharing spiritual experiences.

questions.question: How does the healing of the lunatic boy in Matthew 17 teach us about persistence in faith and prayer for our loved ones?
options: Jesus healed the boy after rebuking the devil
The boy was healed by the disciples alone
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus healed the boy after rebuking the devil
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:18 shows Jesus healing the boy by rebuking the devil, teaching us to persist in prayer and faith when interceding for others.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged because their prayers seem unanswered. What teaching from Matthew 17 can help them understand God's timing and purpose?
options: Jesus said some struggles require prayer and fasting
Unanswered prayers mean God is angry
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus said some struggles require prayer and fasting
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:21 teaches that some spiritual battles need persistent prayer and fasting, reminding us that God's timing and ways may require ongoing devotion.

questions.question: How does Matthew 17 teach about dealing with unbelief in our walk with God?
questions.correctAnswer: Unbelief prevents spiritual victories
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:20 explains that unbelief prevents the disciples from casting out the demon, showing that faith is essential for spiritual breakthroughs.

questions.question: What does Jesus' conversation about paying the temple tax teach us about honesty and integrity in daily life?
options: Jesus teaches to fulfill earthly obligations to avoid offense
Jesus refuses to pay any taxes
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus teaches to fulfill earthly obligations to avoid offense
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:24-27 shows Jesus instructing Peter to pay the temple tax to avoid offending others, demonstrating integrity and respect for lawful obligations.

questions.question: How does Matthew 17 encourage believers to approach trials and suffering?
options: The Son of man will suffer, but will be raised again
Suffering is a sign of God's rejection
Trials should be avoided at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man will suffer, but will be raised again
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:22-23 predicts Jesus' suffering and resurrection, encouraging believers to persevere through trials with hope.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 17, Jesus told His disciples to share the vision of His transfiguration immediately with everyone.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:9 records Jesus instructing the disciples not to tell anyone about the vision until after His resurrection, showing the importance of timing in sharing spiritual truths.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus rebuked His disciples for their lack of faith when they could not cast out the demon in Matthew 17.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:19-20 shows Jesus explaining that their failure was due to unbelief, emphasizing the necessity of faith in spiritual ministry.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, "If ye have faith as a grain of _______, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove."
questions.correctAnswer: mustard seed
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:20 uses the metaphor of faith as small as a mustard seed to illustrate its powerful potential.

questions.question: How does the appearance of Moses and Elias during the transfiguration teach us about the continuity of God's plan?
options: They appeared talking with Jesus, showing the fulfillment of the Law and the Prophets
questions.correctAnswer: They appeared talking with Jesus, showing the fulfillment of the Law and the Prophets
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:3 shows Moses and Elias talking with Jesus, symbolizing that Jesus fulfills both the Law (Moses) and the Prophets (Elias), encouraging trust in God's redemptive plan.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 17 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 17.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'high mountain' where Jesus was transfigured, in the context of Old Testament narratives?
options: It symbolizes the place of divine revelation similar to Mount Sinai
It was the place where David became king
It represents the location of Solomon's temple
It was where Elijah ascended to heaven
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes the place of divine revelation similar to Mount Sinai
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:1 describes a 'high mountain' where Jesus is transfigured, paralleling Moses' encounter with God on Mount Sinai (Exodus 24), establishing Jesus as a new lawgiver and divine revelation.

questions.question: How does Jesus' transfiguration in Matthew 17:2 serve as a typological fulfillment of the Shekinah glory in the Old Testament?
options: His face shines like the sun and his garments are white as light
He performs a miracle of healing
He calls down fire from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: His face shines like the sun and his garments are white as light
questions.explanation: The description of Jesus’ face shining and raiment being white echoes the Shekinah glory of God’s presence (Exodus 34:29-35), revealing His divine nature and fulfilling Old Testament imagery.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figures appear with Jesus during the transfiguration, symbolizing the Law and the Prophets?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses and Elias
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:3 mentions Moses representing the Law and Elijah (Elias) the Prophets, indicating Jesus as the fulfillment of both covenantal traditions.

questions.question: What is the theological implication of the voice from the cloud saying, 'This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him'?
options: It affirms Jesus' divine sonship and authority over Moses and Elijah
It commands the disciples to build tabernacles
It calls for a new covenant with Israel
It identifies Elijah as the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms Jesus' divine sonship and authority over Moses and Elijah
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:5 reveals God's endorsement of Jesus as His Son, surpassing Moses and Elijah, directing the disciples to heed Jesus’ teachings as ultimate revelation.

questions.question: In Matthew 17:9, Jesus instructs the disciples not to tell anyone about the vision until when?
options: The Son of man be risen again from the dead
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man be risen again from the dead
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the Messianic secret motif where Jesus' identity is revealed fully only after His resurrection, emphasizing the fulfillment of prophecy.

questions.question: What question did the disciples ask Jesus concerning Elijah, revealing their understanding of prophecy?
options: Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?
questions.correctAnswer: Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?
questions.explanation: The disciples’ question in Matthew 17:10 shows their awareness of Malachi’s prophecy (Malachi 4:5) about Elijah’s coming before the Messiah.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Matthew 17:12, who has already come in the spirit of Elijah?
questions.correctAnswer: John the Baptist
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:12-13 clarifies that John the Baptist fulfilled the role of Elijah by preparing the way for Jesus, linking prophecy with historical fulfillment.

questions.question: What condition did Jesus indicate was necessary to cast out the demon from the lunatic boy?
options: Faith as a grain of mustard seed
questions.correctAnswer: Faith as a grain of mustard seed
questions.explanation: In Matthew 17:20, Jesus teaches that even a small measure of genuine faith enables the disciples to overcome seemingly impossible challenges, including casting out demons.

questions.question: Which two spiritual disciplines does Jesus mention as necessary to overcome certain kinds of demons?
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and fasting
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:21 highlights prayer and fasting as essential practices for spiritual authority and victory over difficult demonic forces.

questions.question: What prophecy about Jesus does He reveal to His disciples in Galilee in Matthew 17:22-23?
options: He will be betrayed, killed, and raised on the third day
He will reign as king immediately
He will conquer the Romans by force
He will establish a new temple
questions.correctAnswer: He will be betrayed, killed, and raised on the third day
questions.explanation: Jesus predicts His passion and resurrection, central to Christian soteriology, as recorded in Matthew 17:22-23.

questions.question: What cultural or historical practice is referenced when Jesus and Peter discuss paying the temple tax in Matthew 17:24-27?
options: Tribute money paid to the temple authorities
questions.correctAnswer: Tribute money paid to the temple authorities
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:24-27 refers to the half-shekel temple tax required of Jewish males, a practice rooted in Exodus 30:13-16 and upheld in Second Temple Judaism.

questions.question: How does Jesus justify that 'the children are free' from paying the temple tax in Matthew 17:26?
options: Because kings do not tax their own children
questions.correctAnswer: Because kings do not tax their own children
questions.explanation: Jesus uses a royal analogy in Matthew 17:25-26 to indicate that as God's Son, He and His followers are not under the same obligations as strangers or foreigners.

questions.question: What miracle does Jesus perform to secure the money for the temple tax in Matthew 17:27?
options: He tells Peter to catch a fish with a coin in its mouth
questions.correctAnswer: He tells Peter to catch a fish with a coin in its mouth
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs Peter in Matthew 17:27 to find a coin in a fish’s mouth, demonstrating divine provision and authority over nature.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples were able to cast out the demon from the lunatic boy before Jesus rebuked it.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:16 states that the disciples could not cure the boy, and Jesus had to rebuke the devil himself in Matthew 17:18.

questions.question: True or False: The transfiguration event reveals Jesus in glory, foreshadowing His resurrection and exaltation.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The transfiguration in Matthew 17:2 foreshadows Jesus’ resurrection glory and divine status, confirming His messianic identity.

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 17 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 17 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the significance of Jesus being transfigured with his face shining like the sun and his clothes becoming as white as light?
options: It revealed His divine glory as the Son of God
It was a vision given only to Moses
questions.correctAnswer: It revealed His divine glory as the Son of God
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:2 shows Jesus' divine glory shining forth, confirming His deity. This echoes Old Testament appearances of God’s glory (Exodus 34:29-35), the Shekinah glory (Isaiah 6:1-5), and the New Testament affirmation of Christ as the radiance of God's glory (Hebrews 1:3).

questions.question: Who appeared with Jesus during the Transfiguration, and what is their theological significance?
options: Moses and Elijah, representing the Law and the Prophets
Abraham and David, representing the patriarchs
Peter and John, representing the apostles
Isaiah and Jeremiah, representing the major prophets
questions.correctAnswer: Moses and Elijah, representing the Law and the Prophets
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:3 records Moses and Elijah appearing, symbolizing the fulfillment of the Law and the Prophets in Christ. This aligns with Deuteronomy 18:15-19's prophecy of a prophet like Moses, and Malachi 4:5-6 concerning Elijah's return.

questions.question: What did the voice from the cloud declare about Jesus during the Transfiguration?
options: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him
This is a prophet like Moses
This man shall suffer for the people
This is the servant of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:5 quotes God affirming Jesus as His beloved Son, echoing Psalm 2:7 and Isaiah 42:1, affirming Christ’s unique sonship and authority, central to Trinitarian doctrine (John 1:14; Hebrews 1:5).

questions.question: Why did Jesus rebuke the disciples for their inability to cast out the demon from the boy?
options: Because of their unbelief and lack of faith
Because they were not trained enough
Because the demon was too strong
Because Jesus had not given them authority yet
questions.correctAnswer: Because of their unbelief and lack of faith
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:20 explains the disciples' failure was due to their unbelief, emphasizing faith’s essential role in spiritual authority, consistent with Mark 9:23-24 and James 1:6-7 on faith overcoming spiritual obstacles.

questions.question: According to Jesus, what is required to cast out certain kinds of demons as stated in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and fasting
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:21 states that some demons require prayer and fasting to be cast out, highlighting spiritual disciplines that cultivate dependence on God, paralleling Jesus’ own practices (Luke 4:1-2) and Paul’s exhortation to prayer (Ephesians 6:18).

questions.question: What did Jesus predict about Himself while they stayed in Galilee?
options: That the Son of man shall be betrayed, killed, and raised again on the third day
That He would reign immediately as king
That He would perform many miracles
That He would gather all nations
questions.correctAnswer: That the Son of man shall be betrayed, killed, and raised again on the third day
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:22-23 records Jesus foretelling His betrayal, death, and resurrection, central to Christian soteriology (Isaiah 53; Psalm 16:10; 1 Corinthians 15:3-4).

questions.question: What theological meaning is found in Peter's interaction about the temple tax with Jesus?
options: Jesus teaches that the children (believers) are exempt from earthly tribute
Jesus rejects all forms of taxation
Peter is rebuked for questioning taxes
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus teaches that the children (believers) are exempt from earthly tribute
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:25-26 shows Jesus teaching that as God's children, believers are not subject to worldly taxes, but choose to pay to avoid offense, illustrating Christian freedom and submission (Romans 13:1-7; 1 Corinthians 9:20-22).

questions.question: Who did Jesus indicate had already come in the spirit and power of Elijah, according to His explanation to the disciples?
questions.correctAnswer: John the Baptist
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:12-13 clarifies that John the Baptist fulfilled the role of Elijah who was to come, fulfilling Malachi 4:5-6 and Luke 1:17, establishing continuity between Old Testament prophecy and New Testament fulfillment.

questions.question: What was Peter’s response when asked if Jesus paid the temple tax?
options: He asked Jesus what to say
questions.correctAnswer: He said, 'Yes'
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:25 shows Peter affirming that Jesus did pay the temple tax, illustrating Jesus’ submission to cultural and religious customs despite His divine status (Philippians 2:6-8).

questions.question: What did Jesus instruct Peter to do to find the money for the temple tax?
options: Catch a fish and take the coin found in its mouth
Ask the temple authorities for the money
Take money from his own possessions
questions.correctAnswer: Catch a fish and take the coin found in its mouth
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:27 describes Jesus performing a miraculous provision, symbolizing divine provision and sovereignty over creation (Exodus 3:2-6; Jonah 1:17).

questions.question: What did Peter propose during the Transfiguration, and what does it reveal about his understanding?
options: To make three tabernacles for Jesus, Moses, and Elijah, showing a desire to prolong the moment
To build a temple on the mountain
questions.correctAnswer: To make three tabernacles for Jesus, Moses, and Elijah, showing a desire to prolong the moment
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:4 records Peter’s suggestion, indicating his misunderstanding of the Transfiguration’s purpose and a wish to remain in the divine presence, similar to his reaction in Luke 9:33.

questions.question: How did the disciples react to the voice from the cloud and what does this response signify?
options: They fell on their face and were sore afraid, showing reverence and awe
questions.correctAnswer: They fell on their face and were sore afraid, showing reverence and awe
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:6 records their fearful reverence, a proper response to divine revelation, paralleling Exodus 34:5-8 and Revelation 1:17, emphasizing God’s holiness and majesty.

questions.question: When Jesus told the disciples to tell no one about the vision until after His resurrection, what theological principle is highlighted?
options: The Messianic secret and the unfolding of redemptive history
The need for secrecy in discipleship
questions.correctAnswer: The Messianic secret and the unfolding of redemptive history
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:9 reflects the Messianic secret motif, emphasizing that Jesus’ full identity and mission would be revealed progressively, culminating in the resurrection (John 2:4; Mark 8:30).

questions.question: What is the significance of the title 'Son of Man' as used by Jesus in this chapter?
options: It emphasizes both His humanity and divine authority as prophesied in Daniel
It refers only to His human nature
It is a common title for prophets
It identifies Him as a political leader
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes both His humanity and divine authority as prophesied in Daniel
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:22 uses 'Son of Man,' connecting Jesus to Daniel 7:13-14’s vision of a divine figure, underscoring His role as God’s appointed judge and savior (Mark 10:45; Hebrews 2:6-9).

questions.question: What does the healing of the demon-possessed boy illustrate about Jesus’ mission?
options: Jesus’ authority over evil and power to save and restore
Jesus’ focus only on physical healing
Jesus’ inability to heal without faith
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ authority over evil and power to save and restore
questions.explanation: Matthew 17:18 shows Jesus rebuking the demon and healing the boy, demonstrating His victory over sin and evil (Colossians 2:15; Luke 4:18-19), central to Christian salvation.
